description.narrative: The purpose of the Project is to finance a greenfield approximately 835 MW combined cycle natural gas fired power plant (CCGT) investment with an estimated project cost of about USD900 million located 50 km east of Ankara, near the city of Kirikkale, Turkey (the Project). The proposed investment is an A Loan of up to USD125 million and a B Loan of up to USD75 million to Farcan Enerji Uretim Anonim Sirketi (Farcan Enerji or the Company), a special purpose vehicle incorporated in Turkey.

Turkey Country Partnership Strategy FY2012-2015 outlines strategic objectives for fast, sustainable, equitable and inclusive growth that respects the environment. In line with this strategy, the World Bank Group aims to contribute to improved supply of reliable and efficient energy, increased use of renewable energy and climate actions under implementation. The Project will have a significant development impact as it will: (i) increase Turkey's electricity output and help meet the country's growing energy demand and provide power supply security; (ii) in doing so, reduce Turkey's reliance on coal and lignite, thereby reduce carbon emissions in electricity generation; (iii) support power sector reform by increasing the share of private generation in Turkey's overall electricity generation in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (vi) by size and nature of the transaction, influence Turkey's ability to continue to attract foreign investment in the energy sector. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.
